summary: Lone Star Rider collaborates with BSG Wraps to complete his trailer rebuild project supporting the "Riding for a Cure" charitable initiative.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing a bandana and sunglasses, standing outside in front of a modern building, gesturing as he speaks. The scene transitions to a close-up of a motorcycle in motion, with the text "Lone Star Rider" and "100 Motorcycles to Follow" appearing on the screen, indicating a focus on motorcycle enthusiasts. The motorcycle is shown riding on a road, with a trailer attached, and the text "Rider" and "American Diabetes Association" suggests a connection to a charitable cause. The video then returns to the man, who continues to speak and gesture, emphasizing his points. The final scene shows a motorcycle parked in front of a building, with the date "09-03-2020" displayed, possibly marking a significant event or milestone related to the motorcycle or the rider. Throughout the video, the setting remains consistent with an urban environment, featuring modern architecture and a clear sky.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker introducing "part 20" of a trailer rebuild, inviting listeners to stay tuned. A light country rock song then plays, featuring a male vocalist singing about a "Long Star Rider" on a motorcycle, raising money and making friends. This is followed by the male speaker referencing previous parts of the project, mentioning a link below, and stating that the trailer is getting wrapped and he's heading over. The audio concludes with him announcing his arrival at "BSG Wraps."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing a red shirt and a bandana with a star pattern, standing in a parking lot with several cars and a black fence in the background. The text "Thank You For Watching!" appears on the screen, expressing gratitude to the viewers. The scene transitions to a close-up of a black metal gate, partially open, revealing a motorcycle and a van parked behind it. The man reappears, now with a YouTube channel banner displaying the name "Lone Star Rider" and the tagline "Riding For A Cure," indicating his involvement in a charitable cause. The video then shifts to a scenic view of a sunset behind a barbed wire fence, showcasing a beautiful sky with hues of orange and yellow. The perspective changes to a first-person view from a motorcycle, showing the dashboard and the road ahead, with the date "09-04-2020" displayed on the screen. The man continues to ride the motorcycle, passing by various landscapes, including fields and buildings, under a cloudy sky. The video concludes with the man riding through a parking lot, with the text "For $1.00 Per Month You Can" appearing on the screen, suggesting a call to action for viewers to support the channel financially.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker announcing that he's dropping off a trailer to be wrapped, expressing his excitement about it. He specifies the day as Thursday and mentions dropping it off on the other side of the gate.  He remarks on seeing an example of the company's work and restates his excitement. Then, the clip transitions into music, a country-style song, which initially features a guitar intro. The music has an emotional tone. The song includes a female vocalist singing about hoping to make it work and dreams of eternity. Finally, sounds of a car are briefly heard at the beginning of the clip, suggesting an outdoor environment.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a motorcycle's front, showcasing its windshield adorned with stickers and a green license plate. The camera then pans to reveal a building with a large garage door featuring the logo "BSG WRAPS" in bold orange letters, accompanied by the website "www.bsgwraps.com." The building's exterior is light blue, with a smaller blue door labeled "BSG WRAPS" and the slogan "THERE'S A WRAP FOR THAT" in white text. The camera zooms in on the door, highlighting the logo and slogan, before opening the door to reveal a cluttered interior filled with boxes and equipment. The scene transitions to a view of the interior, showing a long hallway with various items stacked against the walls, including a box with the logo "A NOTER." The hallway leads to a brightly lit area with a red vehicle visible in the distance, suggesting a workspace or storage area. The video concludes with a focus on the cluttered hallway, emphasizing the busy and functional environment of the BSG WRAPS facility.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a single male speaker, presenting himself at "BSG Wraps" and indicating he is picking up a vehicle wrap. He then points out, with a slightly humorous tone, that "there's a wrap for that at BSG Wraps". Laughter follows, which concludes the audio clip. Throughout the audio, there is background traffic noise, suggesting an outdoor urban environment.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a man in a workshop, wearing a cap and a dark t-shirt, meticulously working on a large trailer adorned with a "Riding for a Cure" logo and the website "RidingForACure.com." The trailer, featuring a prominent star emblem, is being prepared for an event or campaign related to diabetes awareness, as indicated by the "American Diabetes Association" text. The man, who has tattoos on his arms, is seen applying a blue star sticker to the trailer, ensuring it is properly aligned and adhered. The workshop is filled with various tools and equipment, including a green van with "Schraeder Plumbing" branding and contact information, suggesting a multi-purpose space for vehicle maintenance and customization. The atmosphere is one of focused preparation, with the man's actions highlighting the attention to detail required for the trailer's final appearance. The video captures the essence of teamwork and dedication in creating a visually impactful message for a charitable cause.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male voice expressing surprise and admiration, commenting on what he sees. The sound of machinery, possibly a vehicle, is evident. The male voice continues, describing the "preparation" being done to allow visibility through windows. He exclaims "That is awesome guys," followed by another male voice off-mic adding, "yeah turn out cool." The first male expresses his joy, and it is followed by an introduction to "the man in here, Steph", who is located in a "dark room," as the first male greets him.

events_list.video_caption: In a dimly lit room, a man sits at a desk with multiple computer monitors, engrossed in his work. The room is adorned with a guitar hanging on the wall and a window that offers a glimpse into a garage where a red car is prominently displayed. The man, dressed in a dark shirt, is focused on the screens, which display various applications and a video of a red car driving. The atmosphere is one of concentration and productivity, with the man's attention solely on his tasks. The room's decor, including framed pictures and a small table with a printer, adds a personal touch to the workspace. The video captures the man's dedication to his work, with the red car in the background serving as a constant visual reminder of his passion or interest.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with two male speakers, one expressing his approval of a trailer. The other speaker responds, confirming the trailer's impressiveness. They discuss the quality of work done and transition to a tour of the location for a video. The background features consistent engine sounds, suggesting the presence of a vehicle.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black t-shirt with the text "Broad Street Flyers" and a logo on it, standing in front of a glass door with a blue and white design. He is seen opening the door and entering a garage-like space where various vehicles are parked. The man walks towards a black van with green and white graphics, including the text "Schrader Plumbing" and a phone number "817-262-0989." The van also displays logos for "Moen" and "Bradford White Water Heaters." The man appears to be inspecting the van and its surroundings, which include other vehicles, such as a red van with the text "We Run On Pennzoil" and "Car Care That Comes To You." The garage is well-lit, with a clean and organized environment, featuring tools, equipment, and a car lift in the background. The man continues to walk around the garage, observing the different vehicles and the workspace, which includes a large screen displaying images and various machinery. The video captures the man's interaction with the vehicles and the garage environment, highlighting the branding and services offered by the businesses present.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip opens with background traffic noise, a consistent hum suggesting a busy street. A male voice speaks, offering a tour and stating, "Of course, man, no problem at all," then describes a work in progress, "This is an example of what we do, this is straight-up plumbing." He explains how they've modified a van, originally all white, now entirely black, specifying it's a "Pet Boys project" with five vans being prepared for mobile oil changes and battery services. The traffic noise continues consistently in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a black shirt standing in a workshop, observing a large printer that is printing a red banner with white text and graphics. The workshop is filled with various tools and equipment, including a red car elevated on a lift and a blue and white boat on a trailer. The man walks towards the printer, which is actively printing a large banner with the text "ROCK" visible. The scene then shifts to a close-up of the printer, showing the vibrant colors and intricate details of the printed banner. The man continues to observe the printer, which is now printing a different banner featuring an image of a character from a popular movie. The workshop environment remains consistent, with the red car and blue and white boat still visible in the background. The video then focuses on the red car, highlighting its sleek design and the number "01" on its side, before returning to the man in the black shirt, who is now standing near the printer, observing the printing process. The video concludes with a close-up of the blue and white boat, showcasing its details and the text "1930 Sport" on its side, emphasizing the variety of projects being undertaken in the workshop.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker introducing "all three of our printers", one of which is an HP Latex printer. He then mentions inkjet printers that take a bit to dry. He continues talking about his "general Lee" while also fixing it up. A second male speaker responds with, "Yeah, I think that's awesome, the General Lee." The first male speaker adds that another project is about "80 percent" done and describes a boat that "came in kind of raggedy looking" but "now looks pretty, pretty sharp." The second male speaker agrees it "looks sharp to me." The first male elaborates it was just the bottom that needed work and that it was beat up by docks, but it will leave looking like a "shiny new penny." Throughout the clip, there's a consistent ambient sound of machinery, suggesting an industrial or shop environment.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a boat's hull, showcasing its blue and beige color scheme, with a blue cloth resting on top. A man in a black shirt with a graphic design stands beside the boat, looking towards the camera. The scene transitions to a wider view of a workshop, revealing a black Mercedes van with a red logo on the front, surrounded by various tools and equipment. A person in a green shirt is seen working at a table in the background. The workshop is well-lit, with fluorescent lights on the ceiling and a large mural of a muscular figure on the wall. The camera pans to show more of the workshop, including a large printer and a desk with a computer. The video concludes with a view of the workshop's interior, highlighting the organized and functional space, with a television screen displaying the text "ESG" in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features one male speaker, apparently giving a tour of his workplace, which he identifies as "the air condition shop." He mentions a "laminator" and "table" where they work. The speaker talks in an upbeat tone, saying "everything's been fantastic," and they have "been blessed." The background contains ambient sounds, further establishing the setting as an industrial or workshop environment.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins in a cluttered office space with a large printer, a desk with a computer, and various office supplies. The scene transitions to a workshop where a man in a black t-shirt with "Broad Street Bullies" printed on it stands in front of a red van with white text that reads "COME TO YOU. ROUTINE MAINTENANCE TIRES BATTERIES." The van features logos for Cooper Tires, Goodyear, and Michelin. The man appears to be speaking, gesturing with his hands, and occasionally looking around the workshop. The workshop is filled with various tools, equipment, and vehicles, including a ladder and a large green figure resembling the Hulk. The video captures the man's movements and expressions as he interacts with the environment, emphasizing the busy and industrious atmosphere of the workshop.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker explaining that he wanted to help out, noting that it's good to give back to people doing good things like the person he is talking to. The tone is friendly and supportive. The other male speaker expresses appreciation. The first speaker then indicates he will show the other speaker around his office.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a black shirt standing in a garage, facing a black van with green accents and a logo on its side. The garage is filled with various tools and equipment, including a ladder and a workbench. The man walks towards the back of the garage, passing by a large poster of a guitar with the text "RAMONES" on it. He then enters a room with a pinball machine and a guitar hanging on the wall, decorated with images of a band. The room also features a neon sign that reads "FLYERS," indicating a sports theme. The man continues to walk through the room, passing by a desk with a computer and a window with blinds. The video then shows a close-up of a hockey-themed skateboard mounted on the wall above the window, featuring images of hockey players and a logo with the letter "N." The video concludes with a view of the room, highlighting the various decorations and the window with blinds, reflecting the garage outside.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing the interior of a place, mentioning "this is the bar we're doing for TJ," followed by an expression of enthusiasm. The speaker continues, referencing someone named Jason Arnott, who used to play for the stars and was a Stanley Cup champion, mentioning a banner related to him. A background hum is present throughout the segment, creating an ambiance of being inside a facility.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a man in a room adorned with various sports memorabilia and artwork. He is wearing a black t-shirt with the text "Broad Street Bullies" and a logo. The room features a neon sign that reads "Flyers," a framed picture of a character resembling Chewbacca holding a Stormtrooper helmet, and a restroom sign. The man points towards different items, including a framed picture of a car and a guitar mounted on the wall. The room also contains multiple monitors displaying various images, a guitar with signatures, and a window with a view of a red car outside. The atmosphere is casual and sports-themed, with the man appearing to be explaining or showcasing the items in the room.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features one male speaker with an enthusiastic and informal tone as he discusses work done for Peter Mayhew's neighbor and a friendship involving Peter's daughter. He mentions an autograph from Peter and a connection to Kenny Chesney, followed by a description of the first guitar wrap he created for Tracy Lawrence. This wrap incorporated the text of all the songs Lawrence had written, creating an anniversary guitar. The speaker goes on to mention Darius Rucker and Lynyrd Skynyrd, noting they are just a few of the guitars they've worked on. Throughout the speech, there are prominent background sounds of crackling, which add a textural layer to the overall audio.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins in an office setting, where a man wearing a black "Broad Street Bullies Philadelphia" t-shirt is seen standing near a desk cluttered with papers and a guitar. The office is decorated with various memorabilia, including framed pictures, a guitar hanging on the wall, and a window showcasing a red car on a lift. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation, gesturing with his hands. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man, focusing on his upper body and the details of his t-shirt. The camera then shifts to a wider view of the office, revealing more of the room's contents, such as a Mickey Mouse figurine and a football helmet. The man is seen holding a guitar, indicating a possible interest in music. The video then moves to a different setting, where the man is standing next to a van with the text "Shrader Plumbing" and a phone number visible on its side. The van is parked in a garage or workshop, with various tools and equipment visible in the background. The man appears to be explaining something, gesturing towards the van and the surrounding area. The video concludes with the man standing in front of the van, with a red car and a large inflatable figure hanging from the ceiling in the background, suggesting a connection to automotive or mechanical work.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker mentioning some guitars and a job they did for someone from the band Kings of Leon, resulting in an autograph. He mentions that one of these guitars isn't rat-themed. He says something is "kind of cool" and the speaker immediately corrects him, emphasizing "that is cool". The man adds it's a lot of fun and they do "cool stuff", and then says that someone should be done with that in a few minutes, and they'll "be ready to rock and roll", followed by a question about how people can get a hold of them. The person answers saying BSG Ratz. The speech has a conversational tone. During the speech, there is the presence of background noise, specifically mechanical sounds.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins in a bustling garage where a man in a black t-shirt with a sports team logo stands in front of a red van adorned with various advertisements, including a prominent Pennzoil logo. The van's text reads "WE RUN ON PENNZOIL" and "YOUR CARE THAT COMES TO YOU," along with a phone number and website. The garage is filled with tools, equipment, and another red car elevated on a lift, with a worker in a blue uniform visible in the background. The man holds a brochure and speaks to the camera, gesturing towards the van and the surrounding area. The scene transitions to an outdoor setting where a trailer with a patriotic design and the text "LONE STAR RIDER" is shown. The trailer promotes a cause with the message "MANY ROADS ONE PURPOSE RIDING FOR A CURE.COM" and features logos for the American Diabetes Association and social media icons. The video then shifts to a man wearing a bandana with an American flag design, sunglasses, and a gray t-shirt, standing in front of a building with a modern facade. He speaks to the camera, with the "BSGWRAPS" logo visible on a garage door behind him. The video concludes with the man in the parking lot, with a black truck and other vehicles in the background, as he continues to speak and gesture, emphasizing his points.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker providing contact information for "BSG Wraps.com," including an email and phone number, mentioning their location on the west side of Fort Worth at Frank Kent Cadillac, and expressing their willingness to help. Another male voice expresses appreciation, followed by the first male voice again, stating they're happy to help. A third male voice then exclaims with excitement, "That's say this is freaking awesome," followed by an indistinguishable sound. The third voice then says, "Very cool. This is so freaking cool. They did an awesome job, awesome, awesome job," followed by laughter. The male voice then expresses thanks to "BSG wraps" in Fort Worth, Texas, encouraging listeners to look them up. Finally, the same voice encourages listeners to subscribe to his channel, click the subscribe button and the bell to get notified when new videos are uploaded.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a bandana with a star pattern and sunglasses, standing in a parking lot with various vehicles in the background. He is seen speaking to the camera, gesturing with his hands, and pointing to himself. The scene transitions to a graphic overlay with a wooden background resembling the Texas flag, displaying the text "KEEP RIDING WITH Lone Star Rider" and a "SUBSCRIBE" button. The man continues to speak, and the overlay changes to show different scenes, including a child holding a toy and a woman standing next to a food truck. The video maintains a consistent theme of promoting the "Lone Star Rider" brand, encouraging viewers to subscribe and keep riding with the channel.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker suggesting the viewers to "give it a big thumbs up, share, comment, let me know what you think" if they enjoyed the video. The speaker then encourages the audience to "catch y'all on the road, here at BSG Raps in Fort Worth Texas". Subsequently, the speaker stutters over words at what seems to be the beginning of another sentence.
